lines.text: How much is that big gun?
Oh, you mean the one with the double barrel?
Yes!
Oh, step inside and I'll show it to you.

[follows him inside shop]
And I want a box bullets too!
You certainly can tell good liquor when you taste it!

[Last lines to Cab Driver. Running out of club with Stan and Mrs. Laurel in pursuit]
Out of the city! Anywhere! Anyplace!

[amidst laughing hysterically, sees his wife at another table]
We drank your liquor!
That wasn't liqour; it was cold tea!
Good-bye.

[Calling after Stan as he leaves the house]
Good-bye, Stanley.
[Looking into bushes where Ollie is hiding]
Good-bye, Mr. Hardy.
[Mrs. Laurel closes the front door]
Is she wise?
No. She doesn't suspect a thing.

[Opening lines]
Will you stop! You've been pacing up and down here for the last hour. What's on your mind?
Can I go out?

[Talking on the phone]
Shhhh!
What's the matter? Is your wife there?
Oh, say, do you know where we can get a bottle?
Yeah, my wife's got one. She's been savin' it since prohibition.
Won't she miss it?
No, I'll blame it on the iceman.
